io.odysz.semantic.jsession

Class SSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • io.odysz.semantic.jsession.SSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISessionVerifier, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(description="session manager",
            urlPatterns="/login.serv")
public class SSession
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
implements ISessionVerifier
    Handle login-obj: {a: "login/logout", uid: "user-id", pswd: "uid-cipher-by-pswd", iv: "session-iv"}
    and session-header: {uid: “user-id”, ssid: “session-id-plain/cipher”, sys: “module-id”}
    Session object are required when login successfully, and removed automatically. When removing, the SUser object is removed via session lisenter.
    Be careful with servlet session - created via getSessionId():
    https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2255814/can-i-turn-off-the-httpsession-in-web-xml
    Author:
    ody
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
